meanings.definition: To add fluoride to (a water supply)
meanings.sent1: The city decided to fluoridate the water to improve dental health.
meanings.sent2: It is important to fluoridate the water to prevent tooth decay.
meanings.sent3: The water was so happy when it got fluoridated, it sparkled with joy!
meanings.sent4: Fluoridating the water is like giving it a protective shield against cavities.
meanings.sent5: Imagine the water smiling brightly after being fluoridated.

meanings.definition: To treat or impregnate with fluoride
meanings.sent1: The dentist will fluoridate your teeth to make them stronger.
meanings.sent2: It is common for dentists to fluoridate children's teeth for added protection.
meanings.sent3: The toothpaste tube accidentally fluoridated the bathroom mirror, leaving a shiny residue.
meanings.sent4: Fluoridating the teeth is like giving them a superpower against decay.
meanings.sent5: After the dentist fluoridated my teeth, they felt invincible against cavities.
